title: The Sleeping dragon
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Dept. of Planning and Community Development, partner
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.

abstract: The dragon awoke when the twin towers in New York fell in September 2001.
description: The attack on the World Trade Centre in September 2001 resonated with veterans like Graham Atkinson, reminding him of his time in Vietnam during the 1960s and 1970s. Graham tells of how being in the army taught him strength, respect and a sense of dignity for all. Vietnam was a turning point for this Indigenous Australian. He returned highly politicised and railed against violence in his community but left with decades of unresolved memories.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001839; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Indigenous veterans]; Active; 2010
